VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Optimize Checkout for Large Carts

When a buyer's shopping cart contains a large number of items, efficiently convert the cart to an order and ensure that the buyer's checkout experience is uninterrupted. Even if you don't enable Cart Scale, you can enable asynchronous processing for placing an order during checkout flow.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: In previous versions of the managed package, a buyer with a large number of items in their cart could experience significant performance issues when placing an order.

With this enhancement, you can use asynchronous processing for placing orders, even when you don't enable Cart Scale. This enhancement provides better performance for buyers with larger carts on storefronts that continue to use the Shopping Cart page version 2.0 or 1.0.

After you enable asynchronous processing for order placement, the following buyer experience enhancements are available:

An option on the My Orders section of the My Account page, Restore Cart, which reopens and reactivates a cart that corresponds to an order that failed to place asynchronously.
Updated sections of the standard Checkout page for reviewing and confirming an order that was placed asynchronously.
New email templates for notifying a buyer when an asynchronously placed order succeeded or failed

How: After you upgrade the available global data, a new storefront configuration setting, Process Orders Asynchronously, is available under the Checkout module. By default, this setting is FALSE. To always use asynchronous processing for order placement, regardless of the number of items in the cart, change this setting to TRUE.

The new email template for a failed asynchronously placed order, CC Order Async Fail, references two page labels that include placeholder values for links. To ensure that a buyer receives an email that correctly links to your storefront's order pages, edit these page labels to reference your storefront specifically. Complete the steps in Show Order Confirmation Details and Send Order Emails.

NOTE
When you enable Cart Scale, this configuration is ignored. Processing for order placement automatically switches from synchronous to asynchronous, depending on the asynchronous processing threshold.
Asynchronous processing for order placement isn't compatible with guest checkout. All orders are processed synchronously for a guest buyer, even when Process Orders Asynchronously is TRUE.

The API includes the following enhancements that support asynchronous order placement:

A new global method, ccrz.ccApiCart.placeAsync, executes the logic for placing an order and enqueuing the asynchronous Apex jobs. The corresponding logic service provider class, ccrz.ccLogicCartPlaceAsync, defines this logic and provides an extension point for modifying or replacing the default behavior.
A new global method, ccrz.ccApiOrder.restore, reopens the corresponding cart when asynchronous order placement fails. The corresponding logic service provider class, ccrz.ccLogicOrderRestore, defines this logic and provides an extension point for modifying or replacing the default behavior.
A new global method, ccrz.ccApiCoupon.updateOnUse, tracks coupon usage for asynchronous orders. The corresponding logic service provider class, ccrz.ccLogicCartRepair, defines this logic and provides an extension point for modifying or replacing the default behavior.
